body_html:
I was debugging further and got to know that -
If we build the TF in debug mode and execute this test, then the test passes on power platform.

$ bazel build  --compilation_mode=dbg //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
$ pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.3.1*
$ bazel test -c opt  //tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests:array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel

Target //tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests:array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests/array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.556s, Critical Path: 0.01s
//tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests:array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel  PASSED in 3.2s
  Stats over 25 runs: max = 3.2s, min = 1.4s, avg = 2.4s, dev = 0.5s

Executed 0 out of 1 test: 1 test passes.

Should we debug further on this? Or is it some compiler related issue on power and not the TF code issue?
@gunan and @drpngx Can you please provide your thoughts on this. Thanks!

body:
I was debugging further and got to know that -
If we build the TF in debug mode and execute this test, then the test passes on power platform.

```
$ bazel build  --compilation_mode=dbg //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
$ pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.3.1*
$ bazel test -c opt  //tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests:array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel

Target //tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests:array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests/array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.556s, Critical Path: 0.01s
//tensorflow/compiler/xla/tests:array_elementwise_ops_test_cpu_parallel  PASSED in 3.2s
  Stats over 25 runs: max = 3.2s, min = 1.4s, avg = 2.4s, dev = 0.5s

Executed 0 out of 1 test: 1 test passes.

```
Should we debug further on this? Or is it some compiler related issue on power and not the TF code issue? 
@gunan and @drpngx Can you please provide your thoughts on this. Thanks!
